page.title: 18The Craig Inn, Blackridge
page.content:
Blackridge is on the original {Edinburgh}to{Glasgow}coach road. Parts of the tracks that ran from {Armadale}to{Blackridge}are covered with red ash. ..............
At the west towards Glasgow there is moss called{Blawhorn Moss. }Blawhorn Moss got its name when coach drivers blew a horn to tell the people at the Craig Inn they were coming. The tracks are at the back of the school. ..............
At the {Craig Inn }the coach stopped and the horses changed because they were tired. Most of the stables were knocked down and others have machinery in them.
